item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

i put it were you said, i got 15 erros, i ended up moving it down, then just one, then copy and pasted
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
from another method and it worked (idk why)

Edit:
I just tryed it, and whenever i click on “open” it instead equips it? and the image isnt a christmas cracker…

item.dc:creator: @Praktikanten Praktikanten
item.description:
@Praktikanten wrote:

Where did you put this code? You put it where I wrote right?
If you did, I have no idea why you are getting those errors, works fine for me. (I use Halfling’s webclient by the way.)

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

Class8.java:437: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable aStringarray189
location: class Class8
class8.aStringarray189 = new String[5];
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

edit: fixed it ! thanks so much >:D

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @Praktikanten Praktikanten
item.description:
@Praktikanten wrote:

[quote=“m st3r8, post:7, topic:348975”][quote author=Praktikanten link=topic=445346.msg3269771#msg3269771 date=1279118809]
This probably isn’t the best way to fix your problem, but anyways…

In your client folder, open class8.java and find “public static final Class8 method198” and add this:

if(i == 339) //The item ID of an item you don't need, in this case I took cooked cod { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Open";//New option class8.anInt174 = 2637; //Model ID (I think this is model id for christmas cracker) class8.anInt181 = 595;//Model Zoom class8.anInt190 = 5;//Model Rotation class8.anInt198 = 4;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt204 = 138;//Unknown class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.anInt169 = 0;// model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 0;//model offset increase to move up class8.anInt175 = 56;//Unknown class8.anInt197 = 116;//Unknown class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Christmas Cracker";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "I wonder whats inside... I hope it's crack.".getBytes();//examin info }
This would (if I didn’t write something wrong) mask cooked Cod with Christmas Cracker.
Now I wasnt able to find where my server handles when you click on a peice of food, but if you search around on yours you might find it and you can add something like “if itemID == 339 then do your code snippet”.

Hope this helped… and if it didn’t, you at least got a bump

EDIT: Don’t use a cooked Cod, use a strange box, since it already has the proper “Open” option
Just do as I did above and change it’s name and model and then in potions.java add this:

case 3062:
c.deleteItem(3062, c.getItemSlot(3062), 1);
c.addItem(Item.randomPHat(), 1);
break;

Hope I helped
[/quote]

uhmm… christmas cracker is 962[/quote]

Yes but if you would have read my whole post you’d have noticed that I didn’t use the acctual Christmas Cracker item, I sudjested that he’d mask Strange Box with Christmas Cracker model (2637), name and examine.

EDIT: Just saw your edit on your last post… Just do it with the cod and mask the option into Open and change the case in potion.java to cod (339).

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

[quote=“Praktikanten, post:2, topic:348975”]This probably isn’t the best way to fix your problem, but anyways…

In your client folder, open class8.java and find “public static final Class8 method198” and add this:

if(i == 339) //The item ID of an item you don't need, in this case I took cooked cod { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Open";//New option class8.anInt174 = 2637; //Model ID (I think this is model id for christmas cracker) class8.anInt181 = 595;//Model Zoom class8.anInt190 = 5;//Model Rotation class8.anInt198 = 4;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt204 = 138;//Unknown class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.anInt169 = 0;// model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 0;//model offset increase to move up class8.anInt175 = 56;//Unknown class8.anInt197 = 116;//Unknown class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Christmas Cracker";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "I wonder whats inside... I hope it's crack.".getBytes();//examin info }
This would (if I didn’t write something wrong) mask cooked Cod with Christmas Cracker.
Now I wasnt able to find where my server handles when you click on a peice of food, but if you search around on yours you might find it and you can add something like “if itemID == 339 then do your code snippet”.

Hope this helped… and if it didn’t, you at least got a bump

EDIT: Don’t use a cooked Cod, use a strange box, since it already has the proper “Open” option
Just do as I did above and change it’s name and model and then in potions.java add this:

case 3062:
c.deleteItem(3062, c.getItemSlot(3062), 1);
c.addItem(Item.randomPHat(), 1);
break;

Hope I helped :D[/quote]

uhmm… christmas cracker is 962

edit: yes i dont want it 100%, also i already have a working mystery box and strange box. any other ways?

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @Praktikanten Praktikanten
item.description:
@Praktikanten wrote:

Yeah that’s true. Althought it’s easier to add (my way wasn’t too hard thought) it might be a tad more inconvenient, seeing how you’d have to find a player to open the Christmas Cracker.

But if you he isn’t looking for 100% perfection, your way is fine and easier to add. (No flaming intended)

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @Praktikanten Praktikanten
item.description:
@Praktikanten wrote:

kickingjamie:

the whole point of the crackers was to use it on someone else so why not add the code to item on player?

Maybe he wants Party Hats to be rarer on his server, like say you get a Christmas Cracker from killing a boss or as a rare drop maybe.
So Christmas Cracker would equal a random party hat instead of 1 party hat for you and 1 for random guy.
I’d guess at least…

@Praktikanten wrote:

This probably isn’t the best way to fix your problem, but anyways…

In your client folder, open class8.java and find “public static final Class8 method198” and add this:

if(i == 339) //The item ID of an item you don't need, in this case I took cooked cod { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Open";//New option class8.anInt174 = 2637; //Model ID (I think this is model id for christmas cracker) class8.anInt181 = 595;//Model Zoom class8.anInt190 = 5;//Model Rotation class8.anInt198 = 4;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt204 = 138;//Unknown class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.anInt169 = 0;// model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 0;//model offset increase to move up class8.anInt175 = 56;//Unknown class8.anInt197 = 116;//Unknown class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Christmas Cracker";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "I wonder whats inside... I hope it's crack.".getBytes();//examin info }
This would (if I didn’t write something wrong) mask cooked Cod with Christmas Cracker.
Now I wasnt able to find where my server handles when you click on a peice of food, but if you search around on yours you might find it and you can add something like “if itemID == 339 then do your code snippet”.

Hope this helped… and if it didn’t, you at least got a bump

Just do as I did above and change it’s name and model and then in potions.java add this:

case 3062:
c.deleteItem(3062, c.getItemSlot(3062), 1);

break;

item.title: Christmas cracker help? [317]
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

i added this to potions: (and a similar string to client.java)

		case 962:
		c.deleteItem(962, c.getItemSlot(962),1);
		c.addItem(Item.randomPHat(), 1);
		break;

(my own code) it compiled fine and everything, but my only option for christmas cracker is use. is there some way to make it so if you click ‘use’ it will send it to case 962?

thanks in advance

Read full topic
